description:
Founded in 2012, Master of Project Academy taught 50,000+ IT & Business professionals in more than 170 countries around the world.

Now, Master of Project Academy's exclusive & premium courses are in Udemy!

You can find several PMP Trainings, but you cannot find Realistic PMP Exams to check your readiness!

  • More than 4,000 students took these exams to check their readiness for REAL Exam
  • 10+ Hours of Comprehensive Content
  • Course Completion Certificate is provided
  • 2 PMP Realistic Exams with solutions and knowledge area references

Note that, this course provides:

  • Lifetime access
  • 30 Days FULL REFUND of your money is guaranteed if you will not be satisfied of this course

By enrolling in this course, you will be able to:

  • Assess your readiness for PMP Exam with 2 FULL REALISTIC PMP Exams
  • Identify your weaknesses in knowledge areas
  • Learn ALL PMP MATH in 1 Hour!
  • Check the solutions from the references to PMBOK5 page numbers
  • Earn 10 PDUs in Category B: Continuing Education
  • Get prompt answers & support from the instructor within 24 hours!

There are lots of PMP study materials to study knowledge areas for the PMP exam. However, there are only a few PMP sample exam providers. With these realistic PMP exams, you will be able to evaluate your readiness for the real exam. It is recommended to schedule your real PMP Exam if you answer 65% or more of the questions (130 questions) in each of these EXAMs correctly. These tests provide:

  • 400 Realistic PMP Exam Questions
  • Answers and rationales of the questions
  • Explanations of the questions referred by knowledge area in PMBOK 5th Ed.
  • Covers 10 knowledge areas

Besides realistic PMP Exams, this course contains PMP Exam Math Review Section which covers all mathematical concepts required to PASS PMP Exam. Lectures are followed with an exercise and solution of exercise in detail. PMP Exam Math Review section covers following topics:

  • Present Value of Money
  • PERT Estimate (Three Point Estimating)
  • Critical Path Method
  • Earned Value Management
  • Number of Communication Channels
  • Expected Monetary Value

A typical PMP exam includes approximately 10% (20 questions) questions from these topics.

Disclaimer: PMI, PMBOK, and PMP are registered trademarks of Project Management Institute.
title: PMP® Full Realistic Exams & PMP® Math Lectures
